intro: Wahlbergella uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower orchid, is a species of orchid native to South Africa. It is characterized by its unique, single flower that blooms on a slender stem. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers a dry climate. Its flowers are usually pale green or yellowish in color, and the leaves are narrow and grass-like. Wahlbergella uniflora is a relatively small plant, often reaching only a few centimeters in height.
